context: Spatia, a spatial memory-aware video generation framework, maintains long-term spatial and temporal consistency by preserving and updating a 3D scene point cloud, enabling realistic video generation and interactive editing. Existing video generation models struggle to maintain long-term spatial and temporal consistency due to the dense, high-dimensional nature of video signals. To overcome this limitation, we propose Spatia, aspatial memory-awarevideo generation frameworkthat explicitly preserves a3D scene point cloudas persistent spatial memory. Spatia iteratively generates video clips conditioned on this spatial memory and continuously updates it throughvisual SLAM. Thisdynamic-static disentanglementdesign enhances spatial consistency throughout the generation process while preserving the model's ability to produce realistic dynamic entities. Furthermore, Spatia enables applications such asexplicit camera controland3D-aware interactive editing, providing a geometrically grounded framework for scalable, memory-driven video generation.
